title: Google\Cloud\Dlp\V2\HybridFindingDetails
name: HybridFindingDetails
description:
Populate to associate additional data with each finding.

Generated from protobuf message google.privacy.dlp.v2.HybridFindingDetails

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.container_details
params.description: Details about the container where the content being inspected is from.

params.name: data.file_offset
params.description: Offset in bytes of the line, from the beginning of the file, where the finding is located. Populate if the item being scanned is only part of a bigger item, such as a shard of a file and you want to track the absolute position of the finding.

params.name: data.row_offset
params.description: Offset of the row for tables. Populate if the row(s) being scanned are part of a bigger dataset and you want to keep track of their absolute position.

params.name: data.table_options
params.description: If the container is a table, additional information to make findings meaningful such as the columns that are primary keys. If not known ahead of time, can also be set within each inspect hybrid call and the two will be merged. Note that identifying_fields will only be stored to BigQuery, and only if the BigQuery action has been included.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels to represent user provided metadata about the data being inspected. If configured by the job, some key values may be required. The labels associated with Finding's produced by hybrid inspection. Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the following regular expression: [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?. Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?. No more than 10 labels can be associated with a given finding. Examples: "environment" : "production" "pipeline" : "etl"

If not known ahead of time, can also be set within each inspect hybrid call and the two will be merged. Note that identifying_fields will only be stored to BigQuery, and only if the BigQuery action has been included.

methods.name: getLabels
methods.description:
Labels to represent user provided metadata about the data being inspected.

If configured by the job, some key values may be required. The labels associated with Finding's produced by hybrid inspection. Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the following regular expression: [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?. Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?. No more than 10 labels can be associated with a given finding. Examples:

  • "environment" : "production"
  • "pipeline" : "etl"

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> labels = 5;
